intro: Brachystylus cristatus, commonly known as the zigzag lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its unique, zigzag-shaped inflorescence. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
